snippet: A relentless chronicler of unrest, Fidaa al-Baali was among the first to show his face on camera, and his own trajectory reflected the shift in the Syrian conflict.
abstract: Fidaa al-Baali, Syrian antigovernment activist and citizen journalist known by many as Mohammed Moaz, dies of shrapnel wounds sustained weeks earlier when government forces shelled his neighborhood on outskirts of Damascus.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD, HWAIDA SAAD and HANIA MOURTADA

lead_paragraph: A relentless chronicler of unrest, Fidaa al-Baali was among the first to show his face on camera, and his own trajectory reflected the shift in the Syrian conflict.

headline.main: Activist Who Documented Syrian War’s Toll Became Its Victim
headline.print_headline: Activist Who Documented Syrian War’s Toll Became Its Victim

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
